performed_via_github_app.name: Cloudflare Workers and Pages
performed_via_github_app.description: The **Cloudflare GitHub App** automatically deploys your code to Cloudflare when you merge a pull request to your GitHub repository. It can also create a new repository on your GitHub account when you get started with a Cloudflare template. This integration also: - Displays the status of your deployments as check runs - Posts links to preview URLs as comments on each pull request (Cloudflare Pages only) For more information, refer to the [Cloudflare Workers docs](https://developers.cloudflare.com/workers/ci-cd/builds/) and [Cloudflare Pages docs](https://developers.cloudflare.com/pages/configuration/git-integration/).

issue.title: Add Turkish (tr) translation
issue.body:
Hello,

My friend and I are interested in contributing a Turkish translation for your game. We noticed that this language is currently missing, and we would love to help make your game accessible to a Turkish-speaking audience.

We are both native Turkish speakers with advanced English skills and would love to contribute.

We will submit our changes to you via a single, organized Pull Request when the translation is complete.

Would you be open to accepting our contribution?

Thank you for considering our proposal.

Best regards,

@altCourier
@meryem-ciftci

issue.title: Sell bib buying process // event loadings // marketplace nust
issue.body:
This pull request refactors several pages and components to improve UI consistency and code maintainability, mainly by replacing custom `Button` wrappers around `Link` elements with direct `Link` components styled as buttons. It also enhances the event listing logic to display only future events, optimizes event and bib data handling, and improves the clarity of status indicators and filtering options. **UI Consistency and Refactoring:** * Replaced `Button` components wrapping `Link` elements with directly styled `Link` components on the forgot password, unauthorized, and error pages, ensuring consistent button appearance and accessibility. ([src/app/[locale]/auth/forgot-password/page.tsxL198-R203](diffhunk://#diff-9613621c0958386dd08037071bb8a1736cea86df9b878fb1ea322692c4c2ed98L198-R203), [src/app/[locale]/auth/unauthorized/page.tsxL5](diffhunk://#diff-11611759b34ac3577375f47e1c8caed11530ac76fe5f2b75dc0d6671f3903651L5), [src/app/[locale]/auth/unauthorized/page.tsxL34-R44](diffhunk://#diff-11611759b34ac3577375f47e1c8caed11530ac76fe5f2b75dc0d6671f3903651L34-R44), [src/app/[locale]/error.tsxL12](diffhunk://#diff-3e6c4f142dfab165df2e62df400133edbf4f55a4d7ee72609a9ed7bbe33abffbL12), [src/app/[locale]/error.tsxL76-R78](diffhunk://#diff-3e6c4f142dfab165df2e62df400133edbf4f55a4d7ee72609a9ed7bbe33abffbL76-R78), [src/app/[locale]/error.tsxL89-R93](diffhunk://#diff-3e6c4f142dfab165df2e62df400133edbf4f55a4d7ee72609a9ed7bbe33abffbL89-R93)) **Event List and Filtering Improvements:** * Updated the event listing to show only future events, both in the main list and in filter options, preventing past events from appearing in search results or filters. ([src/app/[locale]/events/EventListClient.tsxR393-R421](diffhunk://#diff-95fc5d491c1e117f45ab4f9d86fcd8ca62df28c2e78ede8d97675bcb2bfd3378R393-R421), [src/app/[locale]/events/EventListClient.tsxL285-R437](diffhunk://#diff-95fc5d491c1e117f45ab4f9d86fcd8ca62df28c2e78ede8d97675bcb2bfd3378L285-R437), [src/app/[locale]/events/EventListClient.tsxL304-R451](diffhunk://#diff-95fc5d491c1e117f45ab4f9d86fcd8ca62df28c2e78ede8d97675bcb2bfd3378L304-R451), [src/app/[locale]/events/EventListClient.tsxL453-R609](diffhunk://#diff-95fc5d491c1e117f45ab4f9d86fcd8ca62df28c2e78ede8d97675bcb2bfd3378L453-R609)) * Refactored bib data handling by extracting bibs and their counts from prefetched events, allowing for more efficient access and display of bib availability and prices. ([src/app/[locale]/events/EventListClient.tsxL84-R109](diffhunk://#diff-95fc5d491c1e117f45ab4f9d86fcd8ca62df28c2e78ede8d97675bcb2bfd3378L84-R109), [src/app/[locale]/events/EventListClient.tsxL253-R381](diffhunk://#diff-95fc5d491c1e117f45ab4f9d86fcd8ca62df28c2e78ede8d97675bcb2bfd3378L253-R381)) **Event Card Enhancements:** * Improved the event card UI to show clear status badges (available, waitlist, loading), best price calculations from bibs, and more informative action buttons based on bib availability. ([src/app/[locale]/events/EventListClient.tsxR142-R149](diffhunk://#diff-95fc5d491c1e117f45ab4f9d86fcd8ca62df28c2e78ede8d97675bcb2bfd3378R142-R149), [src/app/[locale]/events/EventListClient.tsxL174-R310](diffhunk://#diff-95fc5d491c1e117f45ab4f9d86fcd8ca62df28c2e78ede8d97675bcb2bfd3378L174-R310)) **Minor UI and Code Quality Updates:** * Fixed a small HTML structure issue by changing a `

` tag to a `

` for better semantic correctness in the seller bib client. ([src/app/[locale]/dashboard/seller/sell-bib/SellBibClient.tsxL358-R358](diffhunk://#diff-dc7a2b4de4cb1b00bca068f3c94062996f5a1514c39934a0fa75e6df5b11d87eL358-R358), [src/app/[locale]/dashboard/seller/sell-bib/SellBibClient.tsxL368-R368](diffhunk://#diff-dc7a2b4de4cb1b00bca068f3c94062996f5a1514c39934a0fa75e6df5b11d87eL368-R368)) * Added new translation keys for event card statuses and improved fallback logic for race type labels and filter option labels. ([src/app/[locale]/events/EventListClient.tsxR51-R55](diffhunk://#diff-95fc5d491c1e117f45ab4f9d86fcd8ca62df28c2e78ede8d97675bcb2bfd3378R51-R55), [src/app/[locale]/events/EventListClient.tsxL232-R343](diffhunk://#diff-95fc5d491c1e117f45ab4f9d86fcd8ca62df28c2e78ede8d97675bcb2bfd3378L232-R343))

performed_via_github_app.name: SonarQubeCloud
performed_via_github_app.description:
SonarQube Cloud (formerly SonarCloud) is a SaaS code analysis tool designed to detect coding issues in 30+ languages, frameworks, and IaC platforms. Your code is checked against an extensive set of rules that cover many attributes of code, such as maintainability, reliability, and security issues, on each merge/pull request.

For those requiring US-based hosting, [SonarQube Cloud US](https://sonarqube.us/) offers the perfect alternative. If you need data residency outside the US or within the EU, [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/) with this GitHub app is the ideal solution.

SonarQube Cloud integrates seamlessly into your GitHub workflow and provides clear guidance for resolving any code quality and security issues detected. The majority of popular languages can be analyzed automatically; no configuration is required!

With [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/github), you get:

-   Fast, precise static analysis and feedback on your code
    
-   Support for popular languages, frameworks, and IaC tools
    
-   Free analysis for open-source projects and private projects up to max 50k LoC
    
-   Automatic analysis of pull requests and branches with results reported inline
    
-   IDE Support with [SonarQube for IDE](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarlint/) integration
    
-   Quality Gate (added as a GitHub check) acting at two different levels - first, preventing you from merging pull requests that contain issues - and later, helping you to release only clean, safe code
    
-   Sign up for SonarQube free tier and begin scanning your private and public repositories
    

A [GitHub Action](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/sonarcloud-scan) is available in the marketplace to make it easy for you (for projects where automatic analysis isn't available). SonarQube Cloud also integrates smoothly with Jenkins, CircleCI, TravisCI, CirrusCI, and many other tools.

A free tier is available that allows you to explore the benefits of SonarQube Cloud using your public and private repositories. We also provide a no-commitment, [14-day trial](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarcloud/signup/) of SonarQube Cloud Team for unlimited team members, up to 1.9M LoC, AI CodeFix recommendations, and more. No need to speak with a sales rep or request a license key - get automatic code analysis results on your private projects in minutes! Want to see more examples of SonarCloud in action? You can [explore current Open Source projects in SonarCloud](https://sonarcloud.io/explore/projects?sort=-analysis_date) that are using the [Clean as You Code](https://www.sonarsource.com/solutions/our-unique-approach/) methodology.

What are you waiting for? SonarQube Cloud helps you consistently deliver cleaner, secure software that future developers will appreciate and your users will love. Start writing Clean Code. [Now](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarcloud/signup/)!

Replaced manually written constructor with Lombok‚Äôs @RequiredArgsConstructor, ensuring clean and concise constructor injection.

Enhanced validation annotations by adding custom error messages for better clarity.

Kept DTO clean and consistent with modern Spring practices.

issue.title: WebAssembly not support

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

issue.body:
### Affected version

0.16.1

### Flutter versions

3.22.3

### No same issues found.

- [X] Yes, I search all issues but not found.

### Steps to Reproduce

use subtitles-octopus.js show this message : WebAssembly support detected: no

### Code example

`  WebF(
              background: Colors.transparent,
              devToolsService:
                  ChromeDevToolsService(), // Enable Chrome DevTools Services
              viewportWidth: viewportSize.width -
                  queryData.padding.horizontal, // Adjust the viewportWidth
              viewportHeight: viewportSize.height -
                  queryData.padding.vertical, // Adjust the viewportHeight
              bundle: WebFBundle.fromUrl(
                  'https://xxxxx.xxx/html/ass/index2.html?v=126'), // The page entry point
              onLoadError: (e, r) {
                print('onLoadError---');
              },
              onJSError: (msg) {
                print('onJSError---');
                print(msg);
                print('onJSError---');
              },
            ),`

### Expected results

WebAssembly support detected: no
ReferenceError: 'ImageData' is not defined
    at <anonymous> (https://xxxxx/js/subtitles-octopus.js?v=2:1055:20)
    at SubtitlesOctopus (https://xxxxx/js/subtitles-octopus.js?v=2:1081:5)
    at createAss (about:blank:41:38)
    at test (about:blank:181:13)
    at <anonymous> (about:blank:211:13)

### Actual results

support WebAssembly It's gonna be a beautiful thing.

pull_request.title: Set pango language through ctx.lang
pull_request.body: This would set pango's language through the Canvas context ( `ctx.lang`, docs: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lang ) My goal was to fix issues where the same Unicode codepoint should appear differently in Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, and Japanese (as an example: lang=zh Èó® vs. lang=ja Èó®). This can be done with language-specific fonts, but modern fonts often support all options and use the lang tag. Han unification: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_unification Related issue for Chrome client-side canvas: https://github.com/mapbox/tiny-sdf/pull/58 I'm submitting the code and test as a draft PR because **this is still failing** to change the output. I did rebuild bindings, and tried with and without `pango_cairo_update_layout`. Other ideas: this is failing to set the language, setting it at the wrong time, the fonts or something needs to be reset, or pango handles Han unification using something else? I'm a longtime node-canvas user but new to the internals. I found this reference to `PANGO_LANGUAGE` and `%PANGO_SCRIPT_HAN` https://github.com/gtk-rs/gir-files/blob/main/Pango-1.0.gir#L11631

repo.name: node-canvas
repo.description: Node canvas is a Cairo backed Canvas implementation for NodeJS.

repo.description: Node canvas is a Cairo backed Canvas implementation for NodeJS.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -486,6 +486,24 @@ describe('Canvas', function () {
     assert.equal(ctx.font, '15px Arial, sans-serif')
   })
 
+  it('Context2d#lang=', function () {
+    const canvas1 = createCanvas(200, 200)
+    const ctx1 = canvas1.getContext('2d')
+    assert.equal(ctx1.lang, '')
+    ctx1.font = '20px sans-serif';
+    ctx1.lang = 'ja'
+    assert.equal(ctx1.lang, 'ja')
+    ctx1.fillText('Èó®', 10, 10)
+
+    const canvas2 = createCanvas(200, 200)
+    const ctx2 = canvas2.getContext('2d')
+    ctx2.font = '20px sans-serif';
+    ctx2.lang = 'zh'
+    ctx2.fillText('Èó®', 10, 10)
+
+    assert.notDeepEqual(ctx1.getImageData(10, 10, 40, 40), ctx2.getImageData(10, 10, 40, 40))
+  })
comment.body: This test won't work on an OS that doesn't come preinstalled with fonts that support the different languages. I'd be happy with just an update to the `describe('Context2d#save()/restore()'` test. But we could also add a font to the repo if it's small enough.

pull_request.title: Set pango language through ctx.lang
pull_request.body: This would set pango's language through the Canvas context ( `ctx.lang`, docs: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lang ) My goal was to fix issues where the same Unicode codepoint should appear differently in Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, and Japanese (as an example: lang=zh Èó® vs. lang=ja Èó®). This can be done with language-specific fonts, but modern fonts often support all options and use the lang tag. Han unification: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_unification Related issue for Chrome client-side canvas: https://github.com/mapbox/tiny-sdf/pull/58 I'm submitting the code and test as a draft PR because **this is still failing** to change the output. I did rebuild bindings, and tried with and without `pango_cairo_update_layout`. Other ideas: this is failing to set the language, setting it at the wrong time, the fonts or something needs to be reset, or pango handles Han unification using something else? I'm a longtime node-canvas user but new to the internals. I found this reference to `PANGO_LANGUAGE` and `%PANGO_SCRIPT_HAN` https://github.com/gtk-rs/gir-files/blob/main/Pango-1.0.gir#L11631

pull_request.body:
## Description

<!-- Provide a brief description of the changes in this PR -->

## Type of Change

<!-- Mark with an `x` all the checkboxes that apply -->

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes)
- [ ] Tests (adding or updating tests)
- [ ] Performance improvement

## Testing

<!-- Describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes -->

- [ ] Unit tests pass
- [ ] Integration tests pass
- [ ] Manual testing completed
- [ ] E2E tests pass (if applicable)

## Checklist

<!-- Mark with an `x` all the checkboxes that apply -->

- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published

## Screenshots (if applicable)

<!-- Add screenshots to help explain your changes -->

## Additional Notes

<!-- Add any other context about the pull request here -->

pull_request.title: refact: Clean up `VersionsButton`
pull_request.body:
## Description
<!-- 
Add info about why this PR exists and the decisions that went into it.
This info is meant for the reviewer of this PR.
 
You may keep it short or omit it if it's a simple PR. Please add more
context and a summary of changes if it's a more complex PR. 

Make sure to point your PR to the relevant develop branches, e.g.
`develop-patch`, `develop-minor` or `v6/develop`.

How to contribute: https://contribute.getkirby.com
-->


Splitting up the code in `VersionsButton` into smaller methods - makes it easier to customize it a bit further down the road in a v6 PR. But I think these changes could already go into v5.1.

commits.message:
ADD: Auto-calculate SOL received based on market cap change

- Live calculation when typing exit market cap or changing K/M/B
- Calculates percentage change: (exit_mcap - entry_mcap) / entry_mcap
- Auto-fills SOL received: entry_amount √ó (1 + percentage_change)
- Example: Entry 1 SOL @ 2.1B ‚Üí Exit 2.5B = +19% ‚Üí Received 1.19 SOL
- Still editable if manual override needed
- Makes closing trades super fast - just enter exit mcap and confirm\!

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

issue.title: Feature Request: support custom cloudflare R2 domain
issue.body:
Can we support setting the Cloudflare R2 domain name?

In practice, there's a CDN network to optimize Cloudflare R2 downloads, but there doesn't seem to be a way to set this for the Hot Updater.

Currently, there's only the `HOT_UPDATER_CLOUDFLARE_R2_BUCKET_NAME` parameter.

For example, providing a `HOT_UPDATER_CLOUDFLARE_R2_DOMAIN_NAME` parameter.

comment.body:
Sorry for the delayed response. I looked into the issue.

Which version are you using? In the latest version, the hot-updater downloads the bundle through a Cloudflare Worker. Since the Worker accesses R2 directly, an R2 domain isn‚Äôt necessary even if one exists.
Mapping a domain to the Worker should resolve it.

commits.message:
Update README.md

Repace Gitter with Discord

Refactor Register to events package and add TickScheduler

Moved Register.kt to utils/events and updated all imports to reflect the new location. Introduced TickScheduler for improved tick event management, allowing for unregistering scheduled tasks. Refactored Register.onTick to use TickScheduler and updated usages throughout the codebase for consistency and maintainability.

commits.message:
Create MessageDto class for user feedback and message display

- Added MessageDto DTO class to support multi-level message display
- Implements enum-based message levels (INFO, WARNING, ERROR) from MessageLevel
- Provides factory methods for convenient message creation
- Includes comprehensive validation using Jakarta Bean Validation
- Maps COBOL ERRMSG and informational message patterns to modern Java DTO
- Supports BMS message field replacement in React frontend integration
- Created by Blitzy agent

commits.message:
Fix undue fetch from remote server at first install

Related issue:
https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uBlock-issues/issues/3761

Regression from:
https://github.com/gorhill/uBlock/commit/69fce3aa6eaa2a34b7e9d2b974674d9da9d49514

Add Azure configuration diagnostic script

- Add check_azure_config.py to help diagnose Azure app registration issues
- Provides step-by-step guidance for fixing Azure app configuration
- Identifies common issues that prevent refresh tokens from working
- Helps users configure Web platform and disable implicit flows
- Essential for resolving 'No refresh token received' errors
